content.1: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit
content.2: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.
content.3: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?
content.4: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.
content.5: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say?
content.6: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?
content.7: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?
content.10: As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:
content.11: There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.
content.12: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
content.17: And the way of peace have they not known:
content.18: There is no fear of God before their eyes.
content.19: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.
content.20: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law
content.21: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;
content.23: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;
content.24: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
content.28: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.
content.31: Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.
